div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington. Northern Division.
In the matter of the application of Arthur B. Martin for Writ of Habeas Corpus. } No. 2852
Affidavit in support of Motion to Institute and for Service of Papers Informa Pauperis
United States of America Western District of Washington } SS

Arthur B. Martin being duly sworn deposes and says that he is the petitioner above named; that because of the affiant's poverty he is unable to pay the costs in the above matter and is unable to give security for costs; that affiant believes he is restrained of his liberty illegally, wrongfully and unlawfully, by Henry M. White, United States Commissioner of Immigration, or such persons acting by, under, or through him; and that affiant is entitled to the redress as alleged and which is more fully set out in the Petition hereby referred to and made a part hereof. Wherefore, affiant asks that he be allowed to prosecute this suit without the payment of costs in advance.
Subscribed and sworn to before me this 24th day of Sept 1914.
div1.ab: JJ Powers Notary Public in and for the State of Washington, residing at Kingston
div1.p: In the District Court of the United States for the Western District of Washington
In the amtter of the application of Arthur B. Martin for Writ of Habeas Corpus.
Affidavit in Support of Motion to Institute and For Service of Papers Informa Pauperis
Filed in the U.S. District Court, Western Dist. of Washington, Northern Division Sep 25 1914 Frank L. Crosby, Clerk. By EML Deputy.
